intro: Paepalanthus flavidulus, commonly known as the yellow sand mat, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense heads, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Paepalanthus flavidulus is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to dry, coastal or inland regions.
